channel.title: InsertAfter : Nicolas Froidure's Blog, Fullstack JavaScript Developper

item.title: Normalizing JSON Data from REST APIs
item.description: Very few developper takes the time to think about how they structure their JSON at the very beginning of the project, it is the best moment to do so though.

item.title: Considerations for Automatic Generation of API Clients
item.description: No one should loose time writing code that can be generated automatically. Here are some tips on how i did it.

item.title: Project Webservices at 7Digital
item.description: A sum-up of my last 6 months working at 7Digital

item.title: Meta NPM Packages
item.description: On managing a lot of NPM modules.

item.title: Toward a stricter query string parser
item.description: With most query string parsers, a lot of URIs can point to the same content. It not only mess you cache system but make your logs less expressive. To avoid those problems i just wrote a stricter query string parser.

item.title: Designing HTTP REST APIs with NodeJS
item.description: Designing good HTTP services is still a hard thing despite the many tools you can find to make them with NodeJS. I'm trying to define a formal approach to architecture them by embracing the HTTP protocol nature and the RESTful principles.

item.title: No more middlewares, please
item.description: Why i think middlewares are a bad thing, how i am replacing them.

item.title: Let's Subset JavaScript
item.description: Currently, it's all about JavaScript and how to compile, transpile and every "ile"y things you could imagine. But what about making JavaScript smaller?

item.title: Create Native NodeJS Modules Fallbacking To Emscripten Ones
item.description: Suprisingly, creating a native module is not that hard. Making it compile on any platform and gracefully handle compilation fails is a bit more tricky.

item.title: Watching Your NodeJS Projects's Dependencies The Easy Way
item.description: Using watchdeps to automagically watch your project's dependencies.

item.title: REST API access control with reaccess
item.description: A presentation introducing reaccess an its use on a MEAN stack.

item.title: Match IE8 With Rework And Gulp!
item.description: Rework is a very powerful tool. It allows working with CSS contents in a friendly manner. Let's improve you IE8 compatibility with it.

item.title: Detecting Bad JavaScript Performance Tests On JSPerf
item.description: JSPerf gives us a simple way to write JavaScript performance tests. Unfortunately, tests found aren't always well designed. Here's how to detect and avoid them.

item.title: Revisiting The JavaScript Singleton Pattern
item.description: JavaScript design patterns are quite good examples to sharp your JavaScript skills. Let's take a look to the singleton pattern.

item.title: Easily Implement Stacks (Fifo) And Queues (Lifo) With JavaScript
item.description: I'm currently reviewing Javascript basis for a personnal project and it appears i often use stacks and queues implicitly. Let's make it explicit and easyer to debug/use.
